metadata.title: CVE-2016-2052 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in HarfBuzz before 1.0.6, as used inGoogle Chrome before 48.0.2564.82, allow attackers to cause a denial ofservice or possibly have other impact via crafted data, as demonstrated bya buffer over-read resulting from an inverted length check inhb-ot-font.cc, a different issue than CVE-2015-8947.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2052` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
chromium-browser-l10n - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
chromium-chromedriver - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.12.5-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.12.5-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.12.5-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.12.5-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.12.5-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.12.5-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

gir1.2-harfbuzz-0.0 - 1.0.1-1ubuntu0.1
libharfbuzz-bin - 1.0.1-1ubuntu0.1
libharfbuzz-gobject0 - 1.0.1-1ubuntu0.1
libharfbuzz-icu0 - 1.0.1-1ubuntu0.1
libharfbuzz0b - 1.0.1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12.5-0ubuntu1').
harfbuzz package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1-1ubuntu0.1').
